Most challenging aspects was moving data from some fifty odd sources into single data repository which can be queried over dremel (columnio) and other analytical tools.

Senior Researcher in the Sustainable Ecosystem Research Group (SERG) Hewlett-Packard Laboratories February 2008  –  March 2011  (3 years 2 months) Our group works on three things:  
 
*- how to measure/compare sustainability, 
 
*- how to improve the sustainability of Information Technology (IT) -- 2% of the world's carbon footprint, and 
 
*- how to apply IT to improve the other 98%. 
 
I am the systems architect and technical transfer lead for our group. I work with other electrical engineers, mechanical engineers, control theory experts, computer scientists (esp. machine learning experts), and an economist. 
 
The bulk of our work on improving IT sustainability is focused on data centers. The work aims to provide IT services at a defined quality (SLA) with the least energy, least materials and least cost possible. 
 
For our data center work, I have developed a sophistiated data model of the data center facilities, IT, and services; and a high-performance messaging architecture that allow us to bring in sensor data from a variety of these systems. The data is related in real-time to the model. 
 
Most of our work is built upon this architecture. We leverage the model and the model-referenced data to do active control of cooling, IT and services. The architecture also supports rich user interfaces for historical reporting and live dash boarding. 
 
I manage several large-scale demonstrators of our work in production data centers. 
 
In addition to the above, I am a member of team standing up a new worldwide business for energy and sustainability for HP. For our data center work, I have developed a sophistiated data model of the data center facilities, IT, and services; and a high-performance messaging architecture that allow us to bring in sensor data from a variety of these systems. The data is related in real-time to the model. 
 
Most of our work is built upon this architecture. We leverage the model and the model-referenced data to do active control of cooling, IT and services. The architecture also supports rich user interfaces for historical reporting and live dash boarding. 
 
I manage several large-scale demonstrators of our work in production data centers. 
 
In addition to the above, I am a member of team standing up a new worldwide business for energy and sustainability for HP. Summary Lead several core teams in Google search ranking, including the team responsible for freshness and a core relevance team. Currently leads search on mobile at Google, including App Indexing and Realtime search. 
 
Designed and developed the architecture and metrics to evaluate search ranking through live traffic experiments. 
 
Lead the launches of major improvements to search including improvements to search result freshness, ranking of natural language queries, and ranking of popular queries. 
 
Conceived the initial vision and prototype development for Now on Tap. 
 
Contributed to building Google Flu Trends in 20% time, a tool which provides estimates of the influenza prevalence in cities around the world.
